org.vertx.groovy.core.streams
[Groovy] Interface WriteStream

org.vertx.groovy.core.streams.WriteStream
  org.vertx.groovy.core.streams.ExceptionSupport
All Superinterfaces:
ExceptionSupport
@groovy.transform.CompileStatic
interface WriteStream
extends ExceptionSupport

Represents a stream of data that can be written to.

Any class that implements this interface can be used by a Pump to pump data from a ReadStream to it.

Authors:
Tim Fox

Method Summary
java.lang.Object drainHandler(groovy.lang.Closure handler)

Set a drain handler on the stream.

boolean isWriteQueueFull()

This will return true if there are more bytes in the write queue than the value set using setWriteQueueMaxSize
java.lang.Object setWriteQueueMaxSize(int maxSize)

Set the maximum size of the write queue to maxSize.

java.lang.Object write(Buffer data)

Write some data to the stream.

 
Methods inherited from interface ExceptionSupport
exceptionHandler
 

Method Detail

drainHandler

java.lang.Object drainHandler(groovy.lang.Closure handler)
Set a drain handler on the stream. If the write queue is full, then the handler will be called when the write queue has been reduced to maxSize / 2. See org.vertx.java.core.streams.Pump for an example of this being used.

isWriteQueueFull

boolean isWriteQueueFull()
This will return true if there are more bytes in the write queue than the value set using setWriteQueueMaxSize

setWriteQueueMaxSize

java.lang.Object setWriteQueueMaxSize(int maxSize)
Set the maximum size of the write queue to maxSize. You will still be able to write to the stream even if there is more than maxSize bytes in the write queue. This is used as an indicator by classes such as Pump to provide flow control.

write

java.lang.Object write(Buffer data)
Write some data to the stream. The data is put on an internal write queue, and the write actually happens asynchronously. To avoid running out of memory by putting too much on the write queue, check the isWriteQueueFull method before writing. This is done automatically if using a org.vertx.java.core.streams.Pump.
